fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Culture and media, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Employment and Social Affairs, Business and Industry, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Digital economy and society, Transport, Borders and Security, Communication
eu_initiatives: Digital Single Market Strategy, Gigabit Society Communication, Electronic Communications Code, e-Privacy Regulation, Copyright and others.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
persons_accredited_for_access_to_europea: DAIA#Gabriel, FUHR#Lise Katrine, GRASSIA#Paolo, Ghazanfari#Sara, Olausson#Kristina
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Group of Experts on EU Trade Agreements #E03556#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3556#Member#C#Multistakeholder expert group to support the application of Regulation (EU) 2016/679#E03537#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3537#Member#C#EU VAT Forum#E02845#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2845#Not a member#C#Subgroup on administrative cooperation between Member States and Businesses in the field of VAT fraud, cooperative compliance and e-Commerce#Stakeholder consultation group for the Fitness Check of EU consumer and marketing law #E03423#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3423#Member#C#VAT Expert Group#E02813#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2813#Observer#C#Smart Grids Task Force #E02892#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2892#Member#C#Steering Committee#European Multi-Stakeholders Platform on ICT Standardisation#E02758#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2758#Member#C
membership: ETNO participates in the Centre for European Policy Studies (CEPS), the Fédération des Associations Internationales de Belgique (FAIB), the UMTS Forum (Associate Member), ICANN's Generic Domain Name Supporting Organisations (Internet Service Providers and Connectivity Providers Constituency and the Commercial and Business Users Constituency), the European Internet Foundation (EIF), the Global eSustainability Initiative (GeSI), the Global Compact, the Internet Society, the International Chamber of Commerce BASIS Group, the OECD BIAC group and the ITU (three Sectors), ECSO (European Cyber Security Organisation), EATA (European Automotive and Telecoms Alliance).
relevant_communication: Regular publications - both online and offline - regarding EU policies, telecoms data, telecoms regulation. Organisation of events on telecom and digital policy, as well as seminars and working groups for ETNO members.
goals__remit: ETNO represents Europe’s telecommunications network operators and it is the principal policy group for European providers of digital networks and services. ETNO’s primary purpose is to develop top-level policy papers and support members in promoting a positive policy environment allowing the EU telecommunications sector to deliver best quality services to consumers and businesses. We also organize some of the main European events for discussing telecom and digital policy.
